channel.title: First c++ game
channel.description:
hi I have been programming in C for about a 2 year now (eventually moved to ++ after I bought a book a few months later), and for some reason, a few months ago I jumped right into game development because I was so determined to do so. well I have been creating failing projects for awhile and like two days ago I finally decided to try and mock the most simplest game mechanic ever thought of - a youtube video gave me the idea.
it's a game about a 32x32px block-like guy slides around picking up 32x32px blocks of some type of brown object - preferably brownies, anyways; this is one of my very many attempts at trying to implement my not-so-well-thought-of OO design, so if you have any pointers you could throw I would appreciate it greatly.
there are too many files in the directory so I choose not to post them here in separate <code> tags to save thread space. i am on a linux distro but the library i am using is not platform dependent so you should be able to run/compile it on any OS.
if you want to use my shitty code go right ahead. no credits necessary:
project folder build1: http://uppit.com/jzrppp57vshk/build1.tar.gz (deprecated) (memory leaks) project folder build2: http://uppit.com/eolmr8oqihac/build2.tar.gz libraries: SDL, SDL_image, SDL_ttf, SDL_mixer you can download sdl at: libsdl.org
modifications/add-ons: it turns its head depending on which way it's moving every time you rank up your speed increases (1.37 * r) you rank up every 10 brownies you pick up awesome super smash bros music sound plays when you pick up shit WASD keys + arrow keys to move new state system (paused, unpaused, menu, title) press ESC to open and close the menu press p to pause and upause the game (must be upaused first) menu buttons (quit, resume) new title screen when paused music pauses and when unpaused the music resumes new logo you can now toggle the music on/off at the title screen two people can now play the game together (use wasd to control player 2 on 2-player mode)
new screenshots: in-game menu (toggle with key escape) http://img848.imageshack.us/i/menuoh.png/
in-game pause option (toggle with key p) http://img545.imageshack.us/i/paused.png/
game title screen (accessed when game starts and when you quit your current game) http://img28.imageshack.us/i/18638021.png/
toggle sound title menu item http://img64.imageshack.us/i/togsound.png/
two players http://img17.imageshack.us/i/twoplayers.png/
LS build 1: [code] App build1.tar.gz data Main.cpp Main.cpp~ update_log.txt [/code]
LS build 2: [code] Accidental-Presidency.ttf ImageHandler.h Stick.cpp~ AudioHandler.cpp ImageHandler.h~ Stick.h AudioHandler.cpp~ logo.bmp Stick.h~ AudioHandler.h Main.cpp System.cpp AudioHandler.h~ Main.cpp~ System.cpp~ build2.tar.gz pickup-stick-sound.wav System.h copyrightinfo.txt Player.bmp System.h~ Debug.cpp~ Player.cpp TextHandler.cpp Debug.h~ Player.cpp~ TextHandler.cpp~ Debug.txt Player.h TextHandler.h Define.h Player.h~ TextHandler.h~ Define.h~ player_sheet2.bmp update_log.txt Exe player_sheet.bmp Utils.cpp Global.h rankup.wav Utils.cpp~ Global.h~ sound.bmp Utils.h Grass1.bmp ssbnes.wav Utils.h~ ImageHandler.cpp Stick.bmp ImageHandler.cpp~ Stick.cpp [/code]

you have to learn the language first, and then the library you want to write games with for graphics, user i/o and sound. both of them take a rather large amount of time, and 2 years isn’t nothing compared to the time game devvers now have taken to be capable to do what they do, and with teams in large quantities.
